item.title: MongoDB for Developer M101P notes
item.description: insertMany(), default ordered: true, once it encounters as error, insert stop. If ordered set to false, it will insert the rest of documents despite any errors. ObjectId: 12-Byte Hex string | _ _ _ _ | _ _ _ | _ _ | _ _ _ | | —————– | ——– | —————- | ——- | | Date (time stamp) | Mac addr | PID (process ID) | Counter |

item.title: Running python 2 and 3 using conda
item.description: I am taking the M101P course to brush up my Mongo skill, the course is kind of dated, it uses Python 2. However, I use Python 3 on my machine by default. I need a quick and easy way to run python 2 scripts without changing my default settings/path. I found conda offer a great out-of-box solution by using environment. A conda environment is a directory that contains a specific collection of conda packages that you have installed.
